full_text: Bee Tal eG Fade esas IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT HRNAKULAM 2018/KER/250 PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA THURSDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 14TH POUSHA, 1939 Cr1.MC.No. 7392 of 2017 CRMC 1634/2017 of I ADDL.DISTRICT COURT, ERNAKULAM CRIME NO. 1337/2017 OF HILL PALACE POLICE STATION , ERNAKULAM. PETITIONER/ACCUSED NO.2 SURESH, AGED 40 YEARS, S/O. SETHUMADHAVAN NAIR, SINDU NIVAS, PARAKKULAM, KUNISSERY, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD. BY ADV.SRI.V.A.JOHNSON (VARIKKAPPALLIL) RESPONDENT (S) /DEFACTO COMPLAINANT & STATE 1. RAMACHANDRAN UNNITHAN, AGED 73 YEARS, S/O. RAGHAVAN UNNITHAN, SREEVALSAM, MKK NAIR NAGAR, TRIPUNITHURA, COCHIN-682 301. 2. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031. R1 BY ADV. SRI.BINDU SREEKUMAR R2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI. T.R. RENJITH. THIS CRIMINAL MISC.CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 04-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Hr.... Oe dC = a Bianca reg 2018/KER/250 Cr1.MC.No. 7392 of 2017 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S) ' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE A CERTIFIED COPY OF THE F.I.R NO 1337/2017 OF HILL PALACE POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM ALONG WITH THE COMPLAINT. ANNEXURE B TRUE COPY OF THE IDENTITY CARD OF THE PETITIONER. ANNEXURE C TRUE COPY OF THE SALE AGREEMENT EXECUTED BETWEEN THE PETITIONER'S FATHER AND THE 1ST RESPONDENT DATED 04-02-2017. ANNEXURE D TRUE COPY OF THE CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION OF THE VEHICLE BEARING REGISTRATION NO KL 05 W 999. ANNEXURE E TRUE COPY OF THE ORDER IN CRL. M.C NO 1634/2017 OF THE COURT OF SESSION, ERNAKULAM DIVISION DATED 23-08-2017. RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS NIL // TRUE COPY// P.S TO JUDGE. Bape hal BISA 2018/KER/250 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 4" day of January, 2018 ORDER Heard. On a perusal of the complaint and the allegations against the 2 accused, who is the petitioner herein, it seems that at the most the complaint is one of breach of contract and nothing more. It cannot invite an offence under Section 420 IPC as against the petitioner. 2. Even though, the learned counsel for the 2" respondent has argued that some documents were forged by the 2 accused, there is no such allegation in the complaint. Matters being so, all further proceedings in Crime No.1337/2017 of the Hill Palace Police Station as against the petitioner herein can be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings as against the petitioner in Crime No.1337/2017 of the Hill Palace Police Station are hereby quashed. Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. se // True Copy // P.A. to Judge
